quizlist.question: On some diesel-electric ships, the DC propulsion motor will only attain half speed when the generator fields are fully excited. Speeds above this are obtained by______?
In a diesel electric plant, raising the generator's field excitation will cause the DC propulsion motor to _________ .?
quizlist.option3: affect main motor speed if done in conjunction with higher generator engine speeds

quizlist.question: To properly use a hook-on-type volt/ammeter in checking current flow, you must first________ .?
quizlist.option1: hook the jaws of the instrument around the insulated conductor
quizlist.option2: de-energize the circuit to allow connection of the instrument in series
quizlist.option3: connect the voltage test leads to the appropriate terminals

quizlist.question: An alternator operating in parallel begins to vibrate severely and eventually trips out on the reverse power relay. The cause of the vibration was a result of ______________________.?
quizlist.option1: the alternator was operating out of synchronism
quizlist.option2: flashover at the alternator collector rings
quizlist.option3: the dropping of load by that alternator

quizlist.question: If a three-phase induction motor malfunctions and drops to a single-phase (one supply line open) ____.?
quizlist.option1: the motor will continue to run if it is not heavily loaded
quizlist.option3: the motor will immediately stop and not be able to be restarted

quizlist.question: The device that most commonly utilizes the principle of electromagnetic induction is the________ .?
Routine maintenance of dry-type transformers should include ____.?
quizlist.option1: cleaning the windings, if accessible, with a vacuum cleaner or very low pressure air
quizlist.option2: cleaning the stator, if possible,with a vacuum cleaner or very low pressure air
quizlist.option3: cleaning the rotor, with a vacuum cleaner or very low pressure air

quizlist.question: A low-voltage protection circuit as used in the electric motor starting equipment, will ____.?
quizlist.option1: prevent the motor from restarting automatically on restoration of voltage
quizlist.option2: allow the motor to restart automatically on restoration of voltage without manually resetting.
quizlist.option3: trip circuit contactors when the motor develops a short circuit due to low voltage

quizlist.question: Loss of residual magnetism in an alternator or generator can be corrected by _____?
quizlist.option1: using a storage battery or battery charger to flash the field
quizlist.option2: running the generator at normal speed with the field rheostat fully counterclockwise
quizlist.option3: running the rotor in the opposite direction for 5 minutes

quizlist.question: The purpose of having low voltage protection for an electric motor circuit is to ___.?
quizlist.option1: prevent excessive current from developing as it is attempting to deliver its required horsepower

quizlist.question: The Wheatstone bridge is a precision measuring instrument utilizing the principle of changes in______ .?
The use of four diodes, in a full-wave bridge rectifier circuit, will_________.?
quizlist.option1: provide unidirectional current to the load
quizlist.option2: allow a very high leakage current from the load
quizlist.option3: convert direct current to alternating current

quizlist.question: In a diesel electric plant, raising the generator's field excitation will cause the DC propulsion motor to _________ .?
Loss of residual magnetism in an alternator or generator can be corrected for by _____?
quizlist.option1: using a storage battery or battery charger to flash the field
quizlist.option2: allowing the generator to run 10% of normal speed for 5 minutes
quizlist.option3: running the rotor in the opposite direction for 5 minutes

quizlist.question: Which of the damages listed can occur to the components of a winch master control switch, if the cover gasket becomes deteriorated?
quizlist.option3: Sparking at the winch motor brushes.

quizlist.question: In electronic circuits, DC voltage can be positive (+) or negative (-) when measured with respect to the _________.?
Tightly knit metal braid wire can be used with a printed circuit board when______.?
quizlist.option1: required to desolder components on the board
quizlist.option2: conductor resistance is not a factor
quizlist.option3: electrically produced magnetic fluxes would cause in accuracies in adjacent components

quizlist.question: A three-phase alternator is operating at 450 volts with the switchboard ammeter indicating 300 amps. The kw meter currently indicates 163.6 KW, with a power factor of 0.7. If the power factor increases to 0.8, the KW meter reading would increase by______.?
An ohmmeter reading of 'zero' ohm between the ends of a wire conductor would provide a positive indication of______.?
Before measuring an unknown resistance with an ohmmeter, you should _____.?
quizlist.option1: short the test leads and calibrate the meter reading to zero
quizlist.option2: short the test leads and calibrate the meter reading to any
quizlist.option3: short the test leads and calibrate the meter reading to more than zero

quizlist.question: Protection against sustained overloads occurring in molded-case circuit breakers is provided by a /an_______.?
In general, polyphase induction motors can be started on full line voltage by means of ________ .?
quizlist.option2: provide a backup means of voltage regulation for emergency starting
quizlist.option3: allow the voltage to be either stepped up or down, depending on the application, to ensure full torque

quizlist.question: A molded-case circuit breaker provides protection against short circuits by using a/an______ .?
Electric propulsion coupling excitation is reduced at slow speed to ________ .?
In a running electric motor, one uses a sound listening bar to detect fault in _______________.?
When replacing a defective transformer in a parallel transformer configuration, which of the following actions must be carried out to insure proper operation of the equipment it serves?
quizlist.option1: The transformer connections must be made as before with regard to the indicated polarity
quizlist.option2: The iron core of the transformer must be flashed to pre-magnetize it
quizlist.option3: secondary leads must be grounded for 10 minutes to remove static charges

quizlist.question: An insulation resistance test is performed on a particular piece of electric instrument. In addition to the resistance reading, what information listed below should be entered in the electrical log?
quizlist.option1: The temperature of the machine at the time the resistance reading was taken
quizlist.option2: The maximum allowable operating temperature of the machine
quizlist.option3: The normal temperature rise of the machine

quizlist.question: Which of the motors for the devices listed below is fitted with an instantaneous overload relay?
To properly use a hook type volt/ammeter in checking current flow, you must first________ .?
quizlist.option1: hook the jaws of the instrument around the insulated conductor
quizlist.option2: tight the jaws of the instrument around the insulated conductor
quizlist.option3: secure the jaws of the instrument around the insulated conductor

quizlist.question: While underway onboard a DC diesel-elecric drive ship, you notice excessive sparking of the brushes on the mainpropulsion motor. You should first_____.?
quizlist.option1: notify the bridge that you will need to slow down
quizlist.option2: decrease the speed of the main generator

quizlist.question: Moisture as a result of condensation occurring inside of the cargo winch master switches, can be reduced by______?
quizlist.option1: using strip heaters inside the switch box
quizlist.option2: using fix heaters inside the switch box
quizlist.option3: using crack heaters inside the switch box

quizlist.question: Modern DC generators are fitted with commutating poles to _____________.?
While paralleling two alternators, the synchronizing lamps remain lit as the synchroscope pointer approaches the 0º. This would indicate that the ____.?
quizlist.option2: alternator power factors are in phase

quizlist.question: When testing the rotor of a synchronous motor for short circuit, a low voltage source is applied across the rotor coils through the collector rings. A coil having a short circuit will be indicated by a_____.?
quizlist.option1: low or zero voltage drop reading while the other coils will have higher readings
quizlist.option2: high voltage drop reading, while the other coil readings will have an equal or lower value
quizlist.option3: fluctuating voltmeter reading, while the other coil readings are steady

quizlist.question: Why is it a poor practice to use a high wattage soldering iron when soldering or desoldering components on a printed circuit board??
quizlist.option1: The foil wire may become loose and separate from the circuit board.
quizlist.option2: The circuit board material may become brittle.
quizlist.option3: The solder needs to be kept to a dull heat dissipating finish

quizlist.question: When a battery is continuously exposed to low temperature, the best procedure to keep it from freezing is to _____.?
Any electric motor can be constructed to be ___?
The proper sequence of securing alternator in service are _______________.?
quizlist.option1: reduce the load to near zero, trip the circuit breaker, stop the prime mover
quizlist.option2: increase the load to near zero, trip the circuit breaker, stop the prime mover
quizlist.option3: reduce the load to near zero, trip the circuit breaker, run the prime mover

quizlist.question: Prior to using an analog type ohmmeter, the leads are purposely shorted together. Which of the following actions should be taken if, when adjusting to zero ohms, the indicating needle can not be returned to zero on the scale?
quizlist.option2: The lead clips should be replaced
quizlist.option3: The test reading should be added to each final reading

quizlist.question: Which of the following statements represents the main difference between a relay and a contactor?
quizlist.option1: Contactors can handle heavier loads than relays.
quizlist.option2: Contactors can handle lightier loads than relays.
quizlist.option3: Contactors cannot handle heavier loads than relays.

quizlist.question: AC generator operating in parallel loses its excitation without tripping the circuit breaker. This will ____.?
quizlist.option1: cause high currents to be induced in the field windings
quizlist.option2: increase the output amperage between the armature and the bus
quizlist.option3: cause the slip rings to melt

quizlist.question: Protection against sustained overloads occurring in molded-case circuit breakers is provided by a/an_______.?
While paralleling two alternators, the synchronizing lamps remain lit as the synchroscope pointer approaches the 0º. This would indicate that the ____.?
quizlist.option2: alternator power factors are in phase

quizlist.question: Magnet chatter or 'pumping' occurring in a magnetic contactor can be caused by___________.?
quizlist.option1: chattering contacts on the control relay
quizlist.option3: dirt or grease on pole faces

quizlist.question: When using a megohmmeter to determine which shunt field coil is grounded in a DC machine, you must____.?
quizlist.option1: disconnect each shunt field coil before testing
quizlist.option2: insulate the field frame from the ship’s hull
quizlist.option3: use a motor driven high capacity megohmmeter

quizlist.question: If field excitation is suddenly lost to an alternator operating in parallel, that alternator will ____.?
quizlist.option1: lose its load and tend to overspeed
quizlist.option3: operated at the same load but with reduced voltage

quizlist.question: The effect of carrying field excitation excessively high on the synchronous motor will result in a ____. ?
quizlist.option1: tendency for the motor to overheat
quizlist.option3: tendency for the motor to overspeed

quizlist.question: When replacing a defective transformer in a parallel transformer configuration, which of the following actions must be carried out to ensure proper operation of the equipment it serves?
quizlist.option1: The transformer connections must be made same as before with regard to the indicated polarity
quizlist.option2: The iron core of the transformer must be flashed to pre-magnetize it
quizlist.option3: The iron core must be grounded to 10 minutes to remove any residual magnetism

quizlist.question: The current at which a magnetic-type overload relay tends to trip may be decreased by raising the plunger further into the magnetic circuit of the relay. This action ___.?
quizlist.option1: increases magnetic pull on the increases magnetic pull on thetrip the relay
quizlist.option2: increases magnetic pull on the plunger and requires more current to trip the relay
quizlist.option3: reduces magnetic pull on the plunger and requires less current to trip the relay

quizlist.question: The rated temperature rise of an electric motor is the ______________. .?
quizlist.option1: normal temperature rise above the standard ambient temperature at rated load
quizlist.option2: average temperature at any given latitude
quizlist.option3: average temperature rise due to resistance at 10% overload

quizlist.question: An open shunt field in a direct current machine may be located by connecting the field circuit to an external power source, equal to the rated field voltage or less, and tested with a voltmeter from _____________.?
quizlist.option1: one line terminal to each coil lead in succession
quizlist.option2: one field coil to each adjacent field coil in turn
quizlist.option3: any suitable ground to any available line lead

quizlist.question: Undervoltage trips are frequently installed on switchboard circuit breakers to ___.?
quizlist.option1: trip out the generator when there is insufficient voltage being delivered to distribution circuits
quizlist.option2: trip out the breaker if the generator overspeeds by 5% but continues to run
quizlist.option3: trip out generators when there is reversal of power in the main circuit

quizlist.question: The ideal frequency of an incoming generator synchroscope pointer for closing the ACB is _______________?
When the synchroscope pointer rotates in a fast direction (clockwise), it indicates that the governor frequency of incoming generator is ______________.?
The number of cells in a 12 volt lead-acid battery is_______.?

An AC generator panel is fitted with two synchronizing lamps and a synchroscope. When paralleling, if the synchroscope pointer is at the noon position and one synchronizing lamp is bright while the other remains dark, this indicates that ___.?
quizlist.option1: the generators are out of phase and one lamp is burned out
quizlist.option2: the incoming generator voltage is too low
quizlist.option3: the generators are in phase but one lamp is burned out

quizlist.question: You are reconnecting to a three-phase induction motor to the supply line. To prevent possible damage to the load, due to the wrong direction of rotation, you should ____.?
quizlist.option1: check the supply line phase sequence, and motor rotation with appropriate indicators, then connect correspondingly marked leads
quizlist.option2: connect the phase indicator to the supply voltage then connect the motor
quizlist.option3: connect the phase indicator to the motor leads, rotate the motor by hand and then connect to the supply voltage.

quizlist.question: An accidental path of low resistance, allowing passage of abnormal amount of current is known as a/an_______?
Before measuring an unknown resistance with an ohmmeter, you should _____.?
quizlist.option1: short the test leads and calibrate the meter reading to „zero
quizlist.option2: adjust the meter’s  pointer to mid-scale

quizlist.question: The shunt use in an ammeter should be connected in_______. .?
quizlist.option1: series with the load and in parallel with the meter movement
quizlist.option2: parallel with the load and in series with the meter movement
quizlist.option3: parallel with the load and in parallel with the meter movement

quizlist.question: Any electric motor can be constructed to be ___?
A resistance in a circuit of unknown value is to be tested using the voltmeter/ammeter method. Therefore, the meters should be connected with _________.?
quizlist.option1: the ammeter in series and the voltmeter in parallel with the resistance
quizlist.option2: both meters in series with the resistance
quizlist.option3: both meters in parallel with the resistance

quizlist.question: When using an ohmmeter to test a semiconductor diode, you find a low resistance in both the forward and reverse bias directions. This indicates that the diode has a/an_____.?
There is no brilliant change in synchro lamps when the synchroscope pointer is in the phase of _____________.?
Which of the following physical characteristics does a wound- rotor induction motor possess that a squirrel cage motor has none?
A direct current passing through a wire coiled around a soft iron core is the description of a simple______.?
Which of the following conditions will occur if the solenoid coil burns on a cargo winch with an electrical brake?
quizlist.option1: The brake will be set by spring force.
quizlist.option2: The motor will overspeed and burn up.
quizlist.option3: The load suspended from the cargo boom will fall.

quizlist.question: The most commonly used electric motor on board is _______________.?

If the driving torque, such as that produced by a diesel engine, creates pulsations when coupled with a synchronous generator operating in parallel; the generator rotor may be periodically pulled ahead or behind its normal position as it rotates. This condition is sometimes called__________.?

A three-phase alternator is operating at 450 volts with the switchboard ammeter indicating 300 amps. The kw meter currently indicates 163.6 KW, with a power factor of 0.7. If the power factor increases to 0.8, the KW meter reading would increase by______.?
In general, polyphase induction motors can be started on full line voltage by means of ________?
Which of the following statements represents an application of a silicon controlled rectifier?
quizlist.option1: To provide DC power for a main propulsion motor
quizlist.option2: For use as a voltage reference diode.
quizlist.option3: For sensing flame in an automated burner.

quizlist.question: When troubleshooting electronic equipment, you should use a high impedance multimeter _______.?
quizlist.option1: so as not to load down the circuit and obtain erroneous voltage readings
quizlist.option2: to prevent excess current flow through the meter that would damage it
quizlist.option3: whenever a low impedance meter is not available, regardless of the components being tested.

quizlist.question: On a vessel with turbo-electric drive, which of the following conditions would indicate that the propulsion motor had cut-out from synchronization with the propulsion generator?
Which of the listed battery charging circuits is used to maintain a wet-cell, lead-acid, storage battery in a fully charged state during long periods of disuse?
Across the line starters are used with AC motors to provide ___________.?
If the bearings of an electrical generator are falling more frequently than expected and the lubricating oil is sludging then you should ____.?
quizlist.option1: check the bearing insulating block on one end of the unit
quizlist.option2: check the connections to the output leads
quizlist.option3: replace the bearing with a sealed roller type

quizlist.question: In an AC synchronous motor electric propulsion plant, propeller speed is controlled by varying the_____.?
quizlist.option3: number of energized main motor poles

quizlist.question: Relative to the direction of rotation, a DC motor commutating pole has the same polarity as the ____________.?
On some diesel-electric ships, the DC propulsion motor will only attain half speed when the generator fields are fully excited. Speeds above this are obtained by______.?
The frequency output of an operating alternator is controlled by the________.?
quizlist.option1: relative speed of the rotor poles
quizlist.option2: number of turns of wire in the armature coil

quizlist.question: The method used to produce electron emission in most vacuum tubes is known as __________.?
Regarding an induction motor, the power developed by the rotor automatically adjusts itself to the ____________.?
quizlist.option1: Power required to drive the load
quizlist.option2: Power required to stop the load
quizlist.option3: Power required to run the load

quizlist.question: Two DC drive propulsion motors provide input to a single output reduction gear. Upon relieving the watch, you notice that the starboard motor indicators show zero current compared to normal voltage and current indicated on the port motor. The problem with the starboard motor could be_____.?
An open primary coil in a simple transformer will be indicated by which of the listed conditions?
quizlist.option1: No voltage on the output of the secondary coil
quizlist.option2: An infinite resistance value on the secondary coil.
quizlist.option3: Low resistance value on the primary coil.

quizlist.question: The variable resistance placed in the rotor circuit of a wound-rotor induction motor provides for_______?
The purpose of having low voltage protection for an electric motor circuit is to ___.?
quizlist.option1: prevent excessive current from developing as it is attempting to deliver its required horsepower
quizlist.option3: protect against reversal of power in the main circuit

quizlist.question: When insulation failure produces a low resistance current path between two conductors, the resulting condition is known as ___.?
Magnet chatter or 'pumping' occurring in a magnetic contactor can be caused by ______________?
quizlist.option1: chattering contacts on the control relay
quizlist.option3: dirt or grease on pole faces

quizlist.question: The immovable part of an electric motor is called _______________.?
While underway onboard a DC diesel-elecric drive ship, you notice excessive sparking of the brushes on the main propulsion motor. You should first_____.?
quizlist.option1: notify the bridge that you will need to slow down
quizlist.option2: decrease the speed of the main generator

quizlist.question: A low-voltage protection circuit as used in the electric motor starting euquipment, will ____.?
quizlist.option1: prevent the motor from restarting automatically on restoration of voltage
quizlist.option2: allow the motor to restart automatically on restoration of voltage without manually resetting.
quizlist.option3: trip circuit contactors when the motor develops a short circuit due to low voltage

quizlist.question: If the driving torque, such as that produced by a diesel engine, creates pulsations when coupled with a synchronous generator operating in parallel; the generator rotor may be periodically pulled ahead or behind its normal position as it rotates. This condition is sometimes called__________.?
Which of the following statements is true concerning a polyphase synchronous propulsion motor?
quizlist.option1: The motor is started as an induction motor.
quizlist.option2: Resistance is gradually added to the rotor circuit.
quizlist.option3: The starting current is held below the rated current.

quizlist.question: Before testing insulation with a megohmmeter, the windings of large machines should be grounded for about 15 minutes just prior to the test, because the ___.?
quizlist.option1: static charge of the machine may give a false reading
quizlist.option2: armature will have a greater number of leakage paths

quizlist.question: The use of four diodes, in a full-wave bridge rectifier circuit, will_________.?
quizlist.option1: provide unidirectional current to the load
quizlist.option2: allow a very high leakage current from the load
quizlist.option3: convert direct current to alternating current

quizlist.question: On a vessel with turbo-electric drive, which of the following conditions would indicate that the propulsion motor had cut-out from synchronization with the propulsion generator?
A semiconductor that decreases in resistance with an increase in temperature is known as a______ .?
Autotransformer starters or compensators are sometimes used with polyphase induction motors to_______ .?
quizlist.option1: reduce the voltage applied to the motor during the starting period
quizlist.option2: increase the voltage for across-the-line starting
quizlist.option3: provide a backup means of voltage regulation for emergency starting

quizlist.question: A molded-case circuit breaker provides protection against short circuits by using a/an______ .?
Before testing insulation with a megohmmeter, the windings of large machines should be grounded for about 15 minutes before the test because the _______.?
quizlist.option1: static charge of the machine may give a false reading
quizlist.option2: armature will have a greater number of leakage paths

quizlist.question: While on watch in the engine room at sea with only one ship's service turbine alternator on line, the entire plant suddenly blacks out without warning. After restoring power, the cause for this casualty was attributed to which of the following faults?
quizlist.option1: The micro switch at the generator throttle trip vibrated open, allowing the main breaker to open via the under voltage trip.
quizlist.option2: Someone pushed the trip button to the 'shore power' breaker.
quizlist.option3: The main air compressor suddenly stopped.

quizlist.question: The shunt use in an ammeter should be connected in_______.?
quizlist.option1: series with the load and in parallel with the meter movement
quizlist.option2: parallel with the load and in series with the meter movement
quizlist.option3: parallel with the load and in parallel with the meter movemen

quizlist.question: One factor that determines the frequency of an alternator is the_______.?
quizlist.option2: number of turns of wire in the armature coil

quizlist.question: The function of no fuse breaker is to isolate the defective circuit from the system so as to protect it from __________.?
Moisture as a result of condensation occurring inside of the cargo winch master switches, can be reduced by______ .
quizlist.option1: using strip heaters inside the switch box
quizlist.option2: installing a light bulb in the pedestal stand
quizlist.option3: coating the switch box internals with epoxy sealer

quizlist.question: The device that most commonly utilizes the principle of electromagnetic induction is the________ .?
The air gap in an induction motor should be checked periodically with a feeler gauge, to prevent possible ____.?
Which of the listed devices is used to measure pressure and convert it to an electrical signal?
When a megohmmeter is used to test the insulation of a large motor, the initial dip of the pointer toward “zero” is caused by ___.?
Autotransformer starters or compensators are sometimes used with polyphase induction motors to_______ .?
quizlist.option1: reduce the voltage applied to the motor during the starting period
quizlist.option2: increase the voltage for across-the-line starting
quizlist.option3: provide a backup means of voltage regulation for emergency starting

quizlist.question: The variable resistance placed in the rotor circuit of a wound-rotor induction motor provides for_______ .?
The rated temperature rise of an electric motor is the ______________.?
quizlist.option1: normal temperature rise above the standard ambient temperature at rated load
quizlist.option2: average temperature at any given latitude
quizlist.option3: average temperature rise due to resistance at 10% overload

quizlist.question: Electric propulsion coupling excitation is reduced at slow speed to ________ .?
In an AC synchronous motor electric propulsion plant, propeller speed is controlled by varying the_____ .?
quizlist.option3: number of energized main motor poles

quizlist.question: Before starting an electric motor after a long stoppage, the operator shall ensure that it is _______________.?
While starting a main propulsion synchronous motor, the ammeter pegs out at maximum and then returns to the proper value after synchronization. This indicates the_______.?
A motor using a rheostat in the motor circuit to vary the speed is called______ .?
Which of the following statements represents the main difference between a relay and a contactor?
quizlist.option1: Contactors can handle heavier loads than relays.
quizlist.option2: Contactors control current and relays control voltage.
quizlist.option3: A relay is series connected and a contactor is parallel connected.

quizlist.question: If a three-phase induction motor malfunctions and drops to a single-phase (one supply line open)____.?
quizlist.option1: the motor will continue to run if it is not heavily loaded
quizlist.option3: the motor will immediately stop and not be able to be restarted

quizlist.question: When using a megohmmeter to determine which shunt field coil is grounded in a DC machine, you must ____.?
quizlist.option1: disconnect each shunt field coil before testing
quizlist.option2: insulate the field frame from the ship’s hull
quizlist.option3: use a motor driven high capacity megohmmeter

quizlist.question: A tubular fuse should always be removed from a fuse panel with ________.?
quizlist.option3: a pair of insulated metal pliers

quizlist.question: Which of the following physical characteristics does a wound- rotor induction motor possess that a squirrel cage motor has none?
A resistance in a circuit of unknown value is to be tested using the voltmeter/ammeter method. Therefore, the meters should be connected with _________.?
quizlist.option1: the ammeter in series and the voltmeter in parallel with the resistance
quizlist.option2: both meters in series with the resistance
quizlist.option3: the ammeter in parallel and the voltmeter in series with the resistance

quizlist.question: An alternator operating in parallel begins to vibrate severely and eventually trips out on the reverse power relay. The cause of the vibration was a result of_________.?
quizlist.option1: the alternator was operating out of synchronism
quizlist.option2: flashover at the alternator collector rings

quizlist.question: The induction motor usually used on board has two main components, namely _______________.?
The leads from an ohmmeter are attached to the leads of an AC motor field coil. A reading of infinity indicates_______.?

While on watch in the engine room at sea with only one ship's service turbine alternator on line, the entire plant suddenly blacks out without warning. After restoring power, the cause for this casualty was attributed to which of the following faults?
quizlist.option1: The micro switch at the generator throttle trip vibrated open, allowing the main breaker to open via the under voltage trip.
quizlist.option2: Someone pushed the trip button to the 'shore power' breaker.
quizlist.option3: The main air compressor suddenly stopped.

quizlist.question: An electric tachometer receives the engine speed signal from a_______?
quizlist.option1: small generator mounted on the engine

quizlist.question: A grounded switch or cables will be indicated by a megohmmeter reading of ___.?
quizlist.option3: being unsteady in the high range

quizlist.question: What is the main movable part of an electric motor?
A hydrometer measures specific gravity by comparing the ____.?
quizlist.option1: buoyancy of the indicator in the liquid in water with the buoyancy of the same indicator in the liquid being measured
quizlist.option2: mass of substance measured with the density of the same substance
quizlist.option3: difference in volume between water and the liquid measured

quizlist.question: When a battery is continuously exposed to low temperatures, the best procedure to keep it from freezing is to _____.?
When replacing a power transistor fitted with a heat sink in a circuit, a coating of silicone grease is applied between the transistor case and the heat sink. This is done to________.?

When testing the rotor of a synchronous motor for short circuits, a low voltage source is applied across the rotor coils through the collector rings. A coil having a short circuit will be indicated by a_____.?
quizlist.option1: low or zero voltage drop reading, while the other coils will have higher while the other coils will have higher
quizlist.option2: high voltage drop reading, while the other coil readings will have an equal or lower value
quizlist.option3: fluctuating voltmeter reading, while the other coil readings are steady

quizlist.question: Where a thermal-acting breaker is required to be used in an area of unusually high, low, or constantly fluctuating temperatures, an ambient compensating element must be used. This element consists of a _____________.?
quizlist.option2: cylindrical spring on the contact arm
quizlist.option3: conical spring on the contact arm

quizlist.question: A semiconductor that decreases in resistance with an increase in temperature is known as a______ .?
You can determine if a circuit breaker has tripped by ____?
quizlist.option1: examining the position of the handle
quizlist.option2: checking for which of the breakers is warm

quizlist.question: Prior to using an analog type ohmmeter, the leads are purposely shorted together. Which of the following actions should be taken if, when adjusting to zero ohms, the indicating needle can not be returned to zero on the scale?
quizlist.option2: The lead clips should be replaced
quizlist.option3: The test reading should be added to each final reading

quizlist.question: The full torque electric brake on an electric cargo winch functions____________.?
quizlist.option1: automatically hold the load as soon as current to the machine is shut off
quizlist.option2: act as a backup brake in the event the mechanical brake  should fail
quizlist.option3: automatically govern the lowering speed of the load

quizlist.question: A motor using a rheostat in the motor circuit to vary the speed is called______ .?
When the non-essential load has been removed from the feeder system but the service generator remains overloaded, this device automatically activates the _____________.?

Two DC drive propulsion motors provide input to a singleoutput reduction gear. Upon relieving the watch, you notice that the starboard motor indicators show zero currentcompared to normal voltage and current indicated on theport motor. The problem with the starboard motor couldbe_____.?
Which of the following statements represents the important factor that must be considered when replacing a faulty diode in a generators excitation field rectifier assembly?
quizlist.option1: Be certain that the replacement diode is the same polarity as the one removed
quizlist.option2: Never alter the diode alignment to cause a change nin the neutral place
quizlist.option3: Replacement of a diode also requires balancing of the rotor with a one-piece rotor lamination to be shrunk fit and keyed to the shaft

quizlist.question: An AC generator panel is fitted with two synchronizing lamps and a synchroscope. When paralleling, if the synchroscope pointer is at the noon position and one synchronizing lamp is bright while the other remains dark, this indicates that ___.?
quizlist.option1: the generators are out of phase and one lamp is burned out
quizlist.option2: the incoming generator voltage is too low
quizlist.option3: the generators are in phase but one lamp is burned out

quizlist.question: If the centrifugal switch or relay used for cutting out the starting winding of a split-phase induction motor fails to open once the motor is in operation, the ____.?
quizlist.option3: motor will immediately stall under load

quizlist.question: The effect of carrying field excitation excessively high on the synchronous motor will result in a ____.?
quizlist.option1: tendency for the motor to overheat
quizlist.option2: tendency for the motor to short circuit
quizlist.option3: tendency for the motor to overload

quizlist.question: The full torque electric brake on an electric cargo winch functions____________.?
quizlist.option1: automatically hold the load as soon as current to the machine is shut off
quizlist.option3: tendency for the motor to overspeed

quizlist.question: AC generator operating in parallel loses its excitation without tripping the circuit breaker. This will ____.?
quizlist.option1: cause high currents to be induced in the field windings
quizlist.option2: increase the output amperage between the armature and the bus
quizlist.option3: cause the slip rings to melt

quizlist.question: The current at which a magnetic-type overload relay tends to trip may be decreased by raising the plunger further into the magnetic circuit of the relay. This action ___.?
quizlist.option1: increases magnetic pull on the plunger and requires less current to trip the relay
quizlist.option2: increases magnetic pull on the plunger and requires more current to trip the relay
quizlist.option3: reduces magnetic pull on the plunger and requires less current to trip the relay

quizlist.question: Which of the following electric motors would be the safest and most reliable to use on the main deck of a vessel in foul weather conditions?
The air gap in an induction motor should be checked periodically with a feeler gage, to prevent possible ____.?
The output voltage of a 440 volt, 60 hertz, AC generator is controlled by the____ .?
When a battery is continuously exposed to low temperature, the best procedure to keep it from freezing is to _____.?
You are reconnecting to a three-phase induction motor to the supply line. To prevent possible damage to the load, due to the wrong direction of rotation, you should ____.?
quizlist.option1: check the supply line phase sequence, and motor rotation with appropriate indicators, then connect correspondingly marked leads
quizlist.option2: connect the phase indicator to the supply voltage then connect the motor
quizlist.option3: connect the phase indicator to the motor leads, rotate the motor by hand and then connect to the supply voltage.

quizlist.question: The leads from a ohmmeter are attached to the leads of an AC motor field coil. A reading of infinity is obtained indicating a/an_______.?
An ohmmeter reading of 'zero' ohms between the ends of a wire conductor would provide a positive indication of______.?

If the driving torque, such as that produced by a diesel engine, creates pulsations when coupled with a synchronous generator operating in parallel; the generator rotor may be periodically pulled ahead or behind its normal position as it rotates. This condition is sometimes called _____________.?
Choose from the equipment below which are NOT fitted to the generator trouble detecting system is an _______.?
On a main switchboard, If all three ground detection lamps burn with equal intensity when the test button is depressed, which of the listed conditions is indicated?
quizlist.option3: there are grounds in two of the three phases

quizlist.question: What is the common type of AC motor used onboard which can also operates on direct current?
The output voltage of a 440 volt, 60 hertz, AC generator is controlled by the____?
An accidental path of low resistance, allowing passage of abnormal amount of current is known as a/an_______?

Where a thermal-acting breaker is required to be used in an area of unusually high, low, or constantly fluctuating temperatures, an ambient compensating element must be used. This element consists of a _____________.?
quizlist.option2: cylindrical spring on the contact arm
quizlist.option3: conical spring on the contact arm

quizlist.question: On a main switchboard, If all three ground detection lamps burn with equal intensity when the test button is depressed, which of the listed conditions is indicated?
quizlist.option2: there are grounds in two of the three phases
quizlist.option3: the voltage to the dark lamp is less than that of the system

quizlist.question: An insulation resistance test is performed on a particular piece of electric instrument. In addition to the resistance reading, what information listed below should be entered in the electrical log?
quizlist.option1: The temperature of the machine at the time the resistance reading was taken
quizlist.option2: The maximum allowable operating temperature of the machine
quizlist.option3: The normal temperature rise of the machine

quizlist.question: The frequency output of an operating alternator is controlled by the________.?
quizlist.option1: relative speed of the rotor poles
quizlist.option2: number of turns of wire in the armature coil

quizlist.question: The synchronous motors excitation source usually comes from _____________.?
A tubular fuse should always be removed from a fuse panel with ________.?
quizlist.option3: a pair of insulated metal pliers

quizlist.question: The timer element found in a reverse power relay obtains its operating torque from________ .?
Which of the following statements concerning analog and digital devices are correct?
quizlist.option1: The variables in digital systems are fixed quantities and the variables in analog systems are continuous quantities.
quizlist.option2: There are no basic differences between the two systems.
quizlist.option3: Analog devices are superior in accuracy compared to digital devices.

quizlist.question: Before touching a small capacitor connected to a de- energized circuit, or even one that is completely disconnected, you should _____.?
quizlist.option1: short circuit the terminals to make sure that the capacitor is discharged
quizlist.option2: Bbe equipped with an insulated fuse puller
quizlist.option3: tag it with a de-energized tag
